noun.description: Something which acts as a stimulus or boost to an activity.
examples: the halving of the automobile tax would provide a fillip to sales

noun.description: A movement made by bending the last joint of the finger against the thumb and suddenly releasing it; a flick of the finger.
examples: the Prince, by a fillip, made some of the wine fly in Oglethorpe's face

verb.description: Propel (a small object) with a flick of the finger.
examples: our aforesaid merchant filliped a nut sharply against his bullying giant

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense make a fillip with the fingers): symbolic; compare with flick, flip.
